meanings.sent1: I always undercook my pasta, so it's too hard to eat.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to undercook the chicken, or it might make you sick.
meanings.sent3: My attempt to undercook the vegetables turned them into a crunchy mess.
meanings.sent4: She tends to undercook her steak, leaving it practically raw in the middle.
meanings.sent5: The chef's decision to undercook the rice resulted in a disappointing meal.

meanings.definition: To cook (food) for too short a time.
meanings.sent1: If you undercook the cookies, they will be doughy in the center.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to undercook microwave popcorn and end up with unpopped kernels.
meanings.sent3: He managed to undercook the soup, serving a lukewarm broth to his guests.
meanings.sent4: The chef accidentally undercooked the fish, leaving it translucent and unappetizing.
meanings.sent5: Don't undercook the eggs, or they will be runny instead of firm.
